file_content.text: Director Rigel truly appreciates your help! Have an excellent day!
Director Rigel will be thrilled to meet with you as soon as possible!
Good day, gentlebeing! My employer has requested a brief conversation with you--please hold!
Master Jedi! I can't believe I'm speaking to someone who's faced the Emperor himself--I'm Director Rigel, Strategic Information Service. We need your help.
Master Jedi! I'm Director Rigel, with the Strategic Information Service. I understand you're an expert in stopping enemy infiltrations--we need that expertise.
At last! The major who took down the best in the Empire. I'm Director Rigel, SIS. We need to talk--immediately.
Captain! I was told you're the one who settled the Voidwolf--I'm Director Rigel, with the Strategic Information Service. We need your assistance.
Four Republic colonies have been wiped out in less than four days. Men, women, children, animals... nothing was left alive.
Was the Empire behind these killings?
An Imperial attack?
No. It wasn't the Empire.
So many dead... I'm very sorry to hear that, Director.
That's terrible.
What do I have to do with a bunch of dead colonists?
So what?
You can get them justice.
I saw the colonies. Afterward? Everything looked normal, except for neat little piles of ashes every few meters. Thousands of them....
All of those people were burned to cinders by their own droids. And that was just the beginning.
Droids are programmed to be loyal. How could they suddenly attack?
Droids couldn't do that.
They were manipulated. Sabotaged.
What do you mean, "just the beginning"?
"Just the beginning"?
You're crazy.
Don't be ridiculous--we don't have time for it.
The droids were reprogrammed to hate their masters. This wasn't the first time it's happened, either, but it's certainly the worst.
We've traced the sabotage to a group of renegade droids called "Directive Seven." They're planning to wipe out every living thing in the galaxy.
How can we stop these renegades before anyone else is hurt?
What can we do?
We can hit them before they have a chance to put their plan into action. The navy is assembling a strike team as we speak.
I never thought that droids could be capable of such reckless hate.
That's very disturbing.
No one did.
My team and I aren't about to stand by with something like this in the works, sir.
Not while Havoc is around.
That's what I was hoping to hear.
Every living thing, huh? They'd better get to work if they want to finish anytime soon.
That's a tall order.
This is not a laughing matter, Captain.
If these droids are capable of so much, how am I only learning about them now?
Why haven't I heard of this?
The last thing we need is a panic. We've tried to keep the situation under wraps, but there's no time for subtlety now.
There's no way a few faulty droids could kill everything in the galaxy.
I don't buy it.
You aren't listening. We have the intelligence--this threat is very real.
If we don't act soon, it will be too late. The navy is putting together a strike force as we speak.
We need someone on the ground we can absolutely count on to get the job done. We need you.
A threat this big is too much to ignore. Count me in.
Then I'll do it.
If these droids are really such a threat, I suppose I could lend a hand.
I guess I could help.
If blasting droids is a high-paying opportunity, then I'm in.
As long as the price is right.
You're worried about credits at a time like this? You'll get paid!
That may not be possible.
Don't take too long.
The operation will be launching from the fleet. Come to the coordinates the droid gives you, and I'll brief you on the details.
And... please hurry.
Here is the data you've requested. I hope you've enjoyed your conversation--good day, gentlebeing!
Greetings!
